title: Exploring Experimental Conditions for Analyzing Heterogeneous PbSn Solder Material By Using Electron Probe Microanalysis (EPMA)
content: Solder balls are used extensively in microelectronic devices to form conductive bonds between components of the device. Accurate characterization of solder ball composition is important because the chemical composition can impact critical properties such as mechanical strength, electrical conductivity, and thermal conductivity. Since solder balls are used to fit within limited spaces in microelectronic devices, a non-destructive microanalytical technique such as Electron Probe Microanalysis (EPMA) is preferred, as it can offer spatially resolved elemental analysis of materials [1-3].
